publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: Thalia tell in sober Lays
How ·Geo: Rotchfort. George, ·Jo: Rotchfort. Nim, Dan, ·Dan: Jackson a Clergy man─. Dean Pass their dayes
and should our Gauls-town Wit grow fallow
Yet neget quis Carmina Gallo;
Here (by the way) by Gallus mean I
Not ·a schoolmaster. Sheridan but friend ·a Fellow of ye Colledge. Delany
Begin my Muse first from our Bowers
We Issue forth att different hours
Att Seven the Dean in nightgown drest
Goes round the house to wake the rest
att nine grave Nim, and George facetious
Goe to the Dean to read Lucretius
Att ten my ·Lady Betty Rotchfort. Lady comes and Hectors
and Kisses George and, Ends our Lectors
and when she has him by the Neck fast
Hawls him and scolds us down to break·fast
We squander there an hour and more
and then all hands Boyes to the oare
All Heteroclit, Dan except
who Never time nor Order kept
But by Peculiar Whimsy's Drawn
Peeps in the ponds to Look for spawn
or sees the Worke or ·a Boat on a Cannall. Dragon rowe
or Spoils a text or mends his hose
or But proceed we in our Iournall
att two or after we return all
from the four Elements assembling
Warn'd by the bell all folkes come trembling
from Airy Garretts some descend
some from the Lakes remotest end
My ·late Ld: Ch: Barron Rotchfort. Lord and Dean the fire forsakes
Dan Leaves his Earthly Spade and Rakes
The Loyters Quakes no Corners hide them
and Lady Betty soundly chides them
Now Waters Brought and Dinners done
With Church and King the Ladys gone
Not reck'ning halfe an hour we Pass
in talkeing o're a Moderate Glass
Dan growing Drowsy like a Theife
steals ofto dose away his beef
and this must Pass for reading hammon
While George and Dean goe to ba\g·over·ck\ammon
George, Nim, and Dean, Sett out att four
and then again Boyes to the Oare
But when the Sun goes to the deep
not to disturb him in his Sleep
or make arumbling o'er his head
his Candle out and he abed
We Watch his Motions to a Minute
and Leaves the flood when he goes in it
Now shooted in the shortning day
We goe to Prayers and then to play
till supper Comes and after that
We sit an hour to Drink and Chat
'tis late the old and younger Pairs
by Adam lighted Walk up stairs
The Wary Dean goes to his Chamber
and Nim and Dan to their Garrets \C·over·c\lamber
So when this Circle we have run
the Curtain falls and we have done
I might have mentioned sevlḷ facts
like Episodes between the Acts
att which who Looses and who Wins
Who getts a cold who breaks their Shins
How Dan caught nothing in his net
and his boat was over·Sett
for brevity I have retrencht
How in a Lake the Dean was Drencht ·\marginal note uncued:\ D: Swift fell out of ye Boat into ye Cannall.
It wo'd be an Exploit to bragg on
How Valient George rode or'e the Dragon
How Steady in the Storm he Sat
and sav'd his Oare \del·and·add·but\ Lost his hat
How Nim, Noe hunter E'er could match him
still brings us hares when he can Catch them
How skillfully Dan mends his nets
How fortune fails him when he setts
or how the Dean delights to Vex
The Ladys or Lampoon the Sex
I might have told him how Dean Percivall
displa\y·over·ie\s his Pedantry unmercifull
How haughty he Lifts up his Nose
to tell what every Schoolboy knows
and with his finger on his thumb
Explaining Strikes opposers Dumb
Nor how his wife that f\e·over·a\male Ped\a·over·o\nt
but now there need noe more be said on't
Shews all her Secrets of house·keeping
for Candles how she trucks her driping
Was forc'd to send three miles for yeast
to brew her ale and raise her Paste
tells Everything that she can think of
how she Cur'd Charly of the Chin·Cough
what gave her Brat and Pigs the measels
and how her doves were kill'd by We\a·over·e\sles
How Iowler howl'd and what a fright
she had with dreams the other night
But now since I have gone soe far on
A Word or two of Lord Cheife Baron
and tell how little weight he setts
on all Whig Papers and Gazetts
But for the Polliticks of ·a Tory News writer. Pue
thinks every sylable is true
and since he owns the King of Sweden
Is Dead att Last without \In·over·E\vading
Now all his hopes are in the Zarr
Why Muscovy is not soe far,
Down the black Sea and up the Streights
and in a Month he's att the Gates
Perhaps from what this Pacquet brings
By Christmas we shall see strange things
Why should I tell of Ponds and Drains
What Carps we meet with for our Pains
of Sparrows tam'd of Nuts Innumerable
to Choake the Girls or to Consume ye rable
But you who are a Scholar know
How transient all things are below
How Prone to Change in human life
Last night ariv'd ·\marginal note, uncued:\Clement Barry. Clem and his wife
this Grand Event halfe broke our Measures
their Reign began wtḥ Cruel Seizures
the Dean Must with his Quilt Supply
the bed in wcḥ these Tyrants Lye
Nim Lost his Wigg·Box Dan his Jordon
My Lady says she Cant afford one
George is halfe scar'd out of his Witts
for Clem getts all the Tiny bitts
Henceforth Expect a diff'erent Survey
this house will soon turn Topsy·turvy
They talke of further alterations
which Causes many Speculations
